page.title: 03Religion in Warton
page.content: St.Oswald's 14th. century church is well attended on Sunday mornings. Groups include Cubs, Brownies, Scouts, Guides, Youth, Mothers Union and Choir of 31. The well kept church reflects the commitment of a well loved and respected vicar, Rev.F.B.Oddy. A small early Methodist Chapel is now having much needed extensions,water supply and toilets. House groups meet midweek. There are 27 members but times when the chapel is crowded. A mission in 1985 followed a joint church mission in 1984. Hyning Hall, since 1974 home of Bernadine Cistercian nuns and Monastery since 1983, attracts Roman Catholics who otherwise go to Yealand, Carnforth, or Lancaster. Quakers attend Yealand's very early Meeting House. Jehovah's Witnesses are active in small numbers and meet at Carnforth.
